This has 2 Audio tracks, first one is FRENCH or RUSSIAN. You have to change to track 2, and it plays it in ENGLISH. It has subtitles for when the movie goes into a the scenes where they speak GERMAN. TY!!!!!!
what r u talking about? how do you switch audio track on an avi file from the media player?

It's easy to change audio tracks using Quicktime Player:

Open the file
Click on Window - Show Movie Properties
Un-check Sound Track 1
Check Sound Track 2

You can even delete Sound Track 1 and re-save the movie.

Simples!
That's great, PartChimp, but you have to pay for the Quicktime (Pro) Player that does that. How about instuctions on how to change the language in a free player such as VLC?
In VLC Media Player - go to Audio - Audio Track - check Track 2....to hear Brad Pitt speak in some kind of Texan or other english...

Great copy!

I used AVIMux to remove the Russian audio track.
Easy Peasy... took about 45 seconds.

V=8

Excellent quality, I give this one a 10 out of 10 for both audio and video compared to the other DVD rips. This is a dual audio DVD rip so you need a media player that supports changing audio tracks if you want it to be in English.

I suggest getting VLC, it's a free lightweight player that works for Windows, Mac, and Linux, and it plays just about every video and audio file type. Just open up this movie in VLC, right click on the video, hover over Audio -> Audio Track -> Track 2

You can get the VLC player @ http://www.videolan.org/
